RESTRICTIONS.Definition: rules or laws that limit what a person can do

QUALIFY.Definition: meet the requirements, satisfy the conditions

COMMAND.Definition: earn (especially for someone famous or important)

WAGE.Definition: a particular amount of money that is paid to an employee

INFLATION.Definition: a general, continuous increase in prices

TRANSFER FEES.Definition: the money paid to transfer a player from one team to another

FURTHER AFIELD.Definition: in places other than the nearest or most obvious one

GOALKEEPER.Definition: the player who guards the team's goal in order to stop the other team from scoring

VIVIDLY.Definition: in a way that produces strong, clear images in the mind

EYE-WATERINGLY.Definition: bringing tears to the eye due to being intense or extreme

MARK.Definition: a level that is considered significant

RECORD-BREAKING.Definition: something that is bigger, higher etc. than anything else before

LIRE.Definition: the standard unit of money in Italy (before the introduction of the euro)

BUBBLE HAD BURST.Definition: something that was successful stopped considered as such

JUSTIFY.Definition: see as reasonable to do something

ECLIPSED.Definition: no longer noticed because something else has become more important

PITCH.Definition: an area with lines for playing football

SPONSORSHIP.Definition: money that is given to support a team

MERCHANDISE.Definition: things that are bought and sold

BROADCASTING.Definition: sending programmes to be shown on TV

RIGHTS.Definition: the legal permission to publish something

DISTRIBUTE.Definition: share, give out to several people

NEGOTIATING.Definition: having formal discussions in order to reach an agreement

FANS.Definition: people who admire and support a sports team

SUBSCRIPTION.Definition: a regular payment in order to use a service

SHELLED OUT.Definition: paid a large amount of money

DRAMATICALLY.Definition: by a large amount or to a great extent

TROPHIES.Definition: prizes given to the winners of a competition

WAGES.Definition: the money earned by an employee

COUNTERPARTS.Definition: people who have the same role but in a different place

ARGUE.Definition: give reasons to support an opinion

DUVET.Definition: a large, soft, cloth bag used as a cover in bed

CAPTURE.Definition: to make somebody interested in something

FACTORS.Definition: facts that influence the result of something

PROVIDE.Definition: have as an available and desirable feature
